bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, August 29, 1874

div1.p: These endorsements and letters of recommendation for Walter Reed relate to his appointment as Assistant Surgeon to the US Army. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, August 29, 1874
div1.p:
3071_ S_G_O_ 1874
3207_ " " " 1874/87
Reed, Walter
667}
2071} 1875.
2959_acp_80
For appointment as Assistant Surgeon, U.S. Army.
Place of Birth, Gloucester Co, Va.
Age, Twenty Three (23) years.
Graduated at University of Virginia, and
Bellevue Hospt Medical College.
Address: 115 Lee Avenue, 235 South 9th Street. Brooklyn, New York.
Harrisonburg, Va.
Recommended by
James F. Harrison, M.D. Chaiman
of the Faculty, University of Virginia
Prof. Austin Flint, Jr. MD, Secretary
of the Faculty. Bellevue Hospt. Med College
E.S. Dunster, MD, Professor of Obstetrics
University of Michigan
Receipt acknowledged
Invitation to appear for examination sent Aug 29, 74
Ackn. receipt Sept. 2, 74 (3207-74)
Board notified Aug. 29, 74
Recvd: S_G_O_ Aug. 24, 74.

div1.head: Letter from A. Flint, Jr. to the Secretary of War, August 11, 1874
div1.opener:
Bellevue Hospital Medical College.
New York, August 11, 1874.
To the Hon. the
Secretary of War,
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to
recommend D. Walter Reed
for examination for the
position of Asst. Surg. U.S.A.

closer.signed:
A. Flint Jr, M.D.
Prof. of Physiology
&c

div1.head: Letter from E. S. Dunster to the Secretary of War, August 15, 1874
div1.opener:
Profile house. White Mountains
August 15, 1874
To the hon. Secry of War.
Washington D.C.
Sir
div1.p:
Walter Reed M.D. an ap-
plicant for examination for the post of Assistant Surgeon
U.S. Army was for fifteen months my assistant in the large
hospitals on Randalls Island. New York City. He is a
graduate in medicine of the Bellevue Hosp. Med. College. N.Y.
& of unexceptionable moral character - while his experience
in his professional work has been rarely equalled by one
of his years. From my long personal association with him
& my knowledge of his subsequent career I know him
to be most thoroughly qualified for the position he
now seeks
I have the honor to remain

closer.signed:
E.S. Dunster M.D.
Prof. of Obstetrics &c in the University
of Michigan; in Dartmouth College &c

div1.head: Letter fragment from Walter Reed, [August 15, 1884]
div1.p:
and have, also, served as Sanitary
Inspector of the Brooklyn Board
of Health, during a period of fifteen
(15) months.
I forward letters of recom-
mendation from the following medical
gentlemen:
Prof. James F. Harrison, M.D.
Chairman Faculty, Univ. of Va.
Prof. Austin Flint, Jr. M.D.
Secretary Faculty, Bellevue College.
and Prof. Edward S. Dunster, M.D.
of the University of Michigan.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Your most obt. Servant,
